parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a CMF number (11240022) at the end.  This strongly suggests an attempt at electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are typically associated with campaign finance reporting and are used by candidates or their representatives.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>While the post doesn't explicitly name a candidate, the advertiser's information clearly states that Claudiu-Iorga Palaz is a candidate for the parliamentary elections, representing Forța Dreptei. The post itself, "MANIFEST pentru un Parlament al bunului simț," is clearly related to his political aspirations and the upcoming elections. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform.  The reach estimate is ">1M," indicating a clear intention to reach a wide audience. This satisfies "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The objective of the post, a "MANIFEST," is to present Claudiu-Iorga Palaz's platform and views to a large audience.  The inherent purpose is to garner support and influence voters to choose him in the election. This directly fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c". The use of paid advertising further reinforces this electoral objective.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic in nature. It lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic reporting. It's a promotional piece advocating for a specific candidate and his political agenda.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a carefully crafted political message designed to promote a candidate and influence voters. The "MANIFEST" format is a common tool in political campaigns.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>887235546850416</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers directly to a candidate (Claudiu-Iorga Palaz), is used during the electoral campaign period (although the end date is given as 1732867200, which needs to be checked against the actual end date of the electoral campaign), has a clear electoral objective (to promote the candidate and influence voters), and is targeted at a wide audience through a paid Facebook advertisement. The presence of a CMF number further strengthens this conclusion.  The only potential argument against it being propaganda would be if the electoral campaign period had officially ended before the post was published.  However, given the information provided, this seems unlikely.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>Claudiu-Iorga Palaz</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>FD</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Claudiu-Iorga Palaz, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024 (verificați data exactă a încheierii campaniei electorale), cu ID-ul postării 887235546850416,  având ca scop promovarea candidaturii sale la alegerile parlamentare pentru Forța Dreptei. Postarea, intitulată "MANIFEST pentru un Parlament al bunului simț" și conținând numărul CMF 11240022, se adresează unui public larg (peste 1 milion de persoane, conform estimărilor), având un efect electoral clar pozitiv pentru candidatul Palaz.  Reclama, cu o cheltuială de 300-399 RON, a fost publicată pe Facebook și Instagram,  utilizând datele de contact miscareapopulara.constanta@gmail.com și +40720888888.  Această acțiune constituie propagandă electorală după încheierea perioadei legale, fiind astfel o încălcare gravă a legislației electorale.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
